title: Champion Reveal: Ornn, the Fire Below the Mountain

embed.description: Champion Reveal: Ornn, the Fire Below the Mountain

body: All the nitty gritty for our newest Freljordian!

replies.body:
He looks interesting and well designed, and I cannot wait for his long lore.

Does the reveal mean you all can start answering questions now?
Err...maybe? Nothing too spoilery but I'll clear up any confusion where I can.
What are his special item upgrades are they more like better long sword or better infinity edge?
More along the lines of a better Infinity Edge than a better Long Sword.

Jesus...

Why?
Do we really need more damage and just give your team a passive advantage for having him on your team?

Your team members still have to purchase the upgrades, it's not free.

It only really becomes a gold advantage if the game gets to the point everyone has 6 items.

No idea what these upgrades are but why only at 6 items?
For example you get... an upgraded IE with {{item:3031}} + {{item:3087}} on an adc for some more gold?
It only becomes a gold advantage at 6 items because since it cost money to get Ornns unique upgrades it means u spent the money on a Ornn upgrade rather then a different item.
I'm concerned about Ornn' lane sustain. Will he be able to non-stop buy potions with his passive without having to back?
He can't make potions. He's a blacksmith not a Alchemist
There's a Star Trek reference in here somewhere, I'm sure of it...
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MULMbqQ9LJ8

Well it depends on what upgrades we are talking about, Ill.. just copy my other reply :D

"its kind of hard to discuss something you dont know lol. It could be "10 extra AD on your IE for 350 more gold", which would be the same as a Long Sword so only good late game.

Or it could be like "your IE makes crit multiplier ~280 instead of 250% for 500 gold", which would be more interesting and wurf at 2 items already."
Still feels like a snowball harder mechanic imo.

IT actually doesn't effect snowballing very much. It does effect late game though. 

The reason is that many times it is better to buy a component towards your second item rather then upgrade a current item to Ornn tier. Just depends on the situation.

can ANY item be upgraded or only specific items?

Like lets say you have a Kog Maw on your team who doesnt build IE but you also have a Ornn.

is it just "tough luck Kog" or can Ornn basically upgrade any item? Is there an upgrade for everybody outthere?
It's not any item, but a good amount. Every champion should likely be able to have something they can upgrade. Tri-Force is upgrade-able which Kog buys sometimes.

Where are you aiming for the power level of the upgraded items to be? I can see this being incredibly hard to balance in the future since once late game hits one team will have a permanent item advantage over the other. It seems kinda shaky honestly, you want the items to be good enough that their effects are noticeable. But at the same time they shouldn't be so strong that comps become built around surviving to late game with Ornn and then insta-winning when your whole team has a full item advantage.

Also since items change stats all the time I would expect that the upgraded items would have to change as well. What are the plans for keeping this up to date as the game changes over time? It seems like a lot of work.
This is subject to change and could be changed further to balance them in the future but currently they cost about 1000g and have about 1000g worth of stats+ effect.

https://pbs.twimg.com/media/DGpyhSZVYAAPg5m.jpg

Why is it that out of all these, the item for mages - Deathcap - is the sole late game item on this list when every other one is an early game item?

Assuming this is legit...
AP is woefully under-represented in this list.
Every other role has at least 1 core item, but mages get shafted considering how few rush, or even build, Rabadon's Deathcap.
2 of the following should probably replace Deathcap -- RoA, Liandry's, Rylai's, Zhonya's or Luden's.
(Selfishly, Liandry's and Luden's would be my vote.  Realistically, I'd probably lean toward Luden's and either RoA or Zhonya's)

Also, how will this affect Howling Abyss, Twisted Treeline and Rotating Maps (like Dominion if it ever comes back)?
There's a couple items on this list that don't appear on other maps... namely Rabadon's Deathcap.
Does this mean that mages just plain can not upgrade an item on the Treeline if Ornn is in the group?
Or that he can shop without dying on The Murder Bridge?
Question: will that item be named quad-force or ornn-force?
